event: World Mental Health Day 2018, with the theme "Young people and mental health in a changing world"
World Mental Health Day 2019, with the theme "working together to prevent suicide"
WHO published guidance on mental health and psychosocial considerations during the COVID-19 outbreak.
WHO shared survey findings showing that the COVID-19 pandemic has disrupted or halted critical mental health services.
World Mental Health Day 2021, with the theme "Mental health care for all: let's make it a reality"
Biden administration issues Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act (MHPAEA) report to Congress detailing early findings of compliance analyses by federal regulators for 171 plans and issuers.
the U.S. transitioned the 10-digit National Suicide Prevention Lifeline to 988, an easy-to-remember three-digit number for 24/7
World Mental Health Day 2022, with a theme "Make mental health & well-being for all a global priority"
Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, Treasury announce proposed rules to strengthen Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act
World Mental Health Day 2023, with the theme "Mental health is a universal human right"
Biden Administration Announces More Than $200 Million To Support Youth Mental Health
U.S. Surgeon General Murthy issued The U.S. Surgeon General's Advisory on Social Media and Youth Mental Health.
Biden announced a strategy to address the country's mental health crisis
U.S. Surgeon General Releases New Framework for Mental Health & Well-Being in the Workplace
